TopicTitle: How to change size of navball only?

Articles.Content: Is there a way to change size of navball without changing size of other parts of UI?

I don't know how to do that, but I posted here to echo your probable issue with it--sometimes it gets in the way. I don't want to pull it down (by pressing its "minimize" arrow), but I wished I could nudge it slightly from left to right sometimes.
there is currently no way to move or size the navball other than minimising it.

there is currently no way to move or size the navball other than minimising it.

Well, if you're willing to deal with other parts of the flightui changing in size, you can make it larger/smaller in settings...

I don't know how to do that, but I posted here to echo your probable issue with it--sometimes it gets in the way. I don't want to pull it down (by pressing its "minimize" arrow), but I wished I could nudge it slightly from left to right sometimes.

EDIT: also, as someone mentioned it somewhere else, it is actually bad idea to put it somewhere else, your perception would start to play tricks on you if it was left or right ;P

I rearrange my own instruments in some flight simulators, and I use configurable MFDs (with artificial horizon) in Orbiter--I never get confused when doing that, so why should the case be different for KSP? I'm asking for just a simple nudge or drag, a little to left or right/ I don't think that's such a big deal. But of course, if the demand for this is low, it's not going to be implemented, but that's fine by me. It was just a wish.

In fact if anything, I would like to make it larger it is only way to make precise maneuvers, isn't it?
